intro: Echidnopsis chrysantha, commonly known as the yellow pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, yellow-orange spherical inflorescence. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Echidnopsis chrysantha is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
